bug.short_desc: nss: significant curl performance regression related to pem_CreateObject
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
There seems to be a crippling performance regression in NSS, as used from curl and the multi interface. pem_CreateObject calls take several seconds to complete after a while.
The stack trace leading to pem_CreateObject looks like this:

Most of the work seems to be spent in getUniquePEMNicknameFromFilename, in calls to PL_HashTableLookup where the key (in the returned_name variable) is of the form "ca-bundle.crt33434", and the numeric suffix keeps increasing.
This is with a long-running process which performs many HTTPS downloads from https://dl.fedoraproject.org/. I haven't managed to reproduce this with the curl command line tool.
This happens on a Fedora 24 Workstation installation where the Red Hat IS certificates have been installed, and update-ca-trust has been run once.
Package versions:
nss-3.23.0-1.2.fc24.x86_64 nspr-4.12.0-1.fc24.x86_64 curl-7.47.1-4.fc24.x86_64

Caused by the following commit: https://git.fedorahosted.org/cgit/nss-pem.git/commit/?id=02f6e5a4
I will just revert the commit because it has never been proved useful. It was blindly implemented in 2014 despite (lib)curl does not search certificates by nicknames since 2011:
https://github.com/curl/curl/commit/f6980bbf
This should be fixed in nss-pem-1.0.2-2.fc23 and newer. Please reopen if not.
